include.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
- code_interpreter_call.outputs: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
- computer_call_output.output.image_url: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- file_search_call.results: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
- message.output_text.logprobs: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- reasoning.encrypted_content: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the store parameter is set to false, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

oneOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

An array of content items generated by the model.
- The length and order of items in the output array is dependent on the model's response.
- Rather than accessing the first item in the output array and assuming it's an assistant message with the content generated by the model, you might consider using the output_text property where supported in SDKs.

output_text.description: SDK-only convenience property that contains the aggregated text output from all output_text items in the output array, if any are present. Supported in the Python and JavaScript SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

previous_response_id.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

variables.description: Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other Response input types like images or files.

version.description: Optional version of the prompt template.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.

status.description: The status of the response generation.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

oneOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

oneOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

An array of content items generated by the model.
- The length and order of items in the output array is dependent on the model's response.
- Rather than accessing the first item in the output array and assuming it's an assistant message with the content generated by the model, you might consider using the output_text property where supported in SDKs.

output_text.description: SDK-only convenience property that contains the aggregated text output from all output_text items in the output array, if any are present. Supported in the Python and JavaScript SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.

status.description: The status of the response generation.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

An array of content items generated by the model.
- The length and order of items in the output array is dependent on the model's response.
- Rather than accessing the first item in the output array and assuming it's an assistant message with the content generated by the model, you might consider using the output_text property where supported in SDKs.

output_text.description: SDK-only convenience property that contains the aggregated text output from all output_text items in the output array, if any are present. Supported in the Python and JavaScript SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

previous_response_id.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

variables.description: Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other Response input types like images or files.

version.description: Optional version of the prompt template.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.

status.description: The status of the response generation.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

oneOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

oneOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.

An array of content items generated by the model.
- The length and order of items in the output array is dependent on the model's response.
- Rather than accessing the first item in the output array and assuming it's an assistant message with the content generated by the model, you might consider using the output_text property where supported in SDKs.

output_text.description: SDK-only convenience property that contains the aggregated text output from all output_text items in the output array, if any are present. Supported in the Python and JavaScript SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

previous_response_id.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

variables.description: Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other Response input types like images or files.

version.description: Optional version of the prompt template.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.

status.description: The status of the response generation.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

oneOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

oneOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.

type.description: For function calling, the type is always function.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of low, medium, or high. medium is the default.

country.description: The two-letter ISO country code of the user, e.g. US.

region.description: Free text input for the region of the user, e.g. California.

timezone.description: The IANA timezone of the user, e.g. America/Los_Angeles.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

An array of content items generated by the model.
- The length and order of items in the output array is dependent on the model's response.
- Rather than accessing the first item in the output array and assuming it's an assistant message with the content generated by the model, you might consider using the output_text property where supported in SDKs.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

An array of content items generated by the model.
- The length and order of items in the output array is dependent on the model's response.
- Rather than accessing the first item in the output array and assuming it's an assistant message with the content generated by the model, you might consider using the output_text property where supported in SDKs.

output_text.description: SDK-only convenience property that contains the aggregated text output from all output_text items in the output array, if any are present. Supported in the Python and JavaScript SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

previous_response_id.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

variables.description: Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other Response input types like images or files.

version.description: Optional version of the prompt template.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.

status.description: The status of the response generation.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

oneOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

oneOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

oneOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

type.description: For function calling, the type is always function.

anyOf.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific function.

tool_choice.description: How the model should select which tool (or tools) to use when generating a response.

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of web_search_preview or web_search_preview_2025_03_11.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of low, medium, or high. medium is the default.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always approximate.

city.description: Free text input for the city of the user, e.g. San Francisco.

country.description: The two-letter ISO country code of the user, e.g. US.

region.description: Free text input for the region of the user, e.g. California.

timezone.description: The IANA timezone of the user, e.g. America/Los_Angeles.

oneOf.description: This tool searches the web for relevant results to use in a response.

display_height.description: The height of the computer display.

display_width.description: The width of the computer display.

environment.description: The type of computer environment to control.

type.description: The type of the computer use tool. Always computer_use_preview.

oneOf.description: A tool that controls a virtual computer.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description: The URL for the MCP server.

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always mcp.

anyOf.description: A string array of allowed tool names.

tool_names.description: List of allowed tool names.

anyOf.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

allowed_tools.description: List of allowed tool names or a filter object.

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to send to the MCP server. Use for authentication or other purposes.

tool_names.description: List of tools that require approval.

always.description: A list of tools that always require approval.

tool_names.description: List of tools that do not require approval.

never.description: A list of tools that never require approval.

require_approval.description: Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

oneOf.description: Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool. Always code_interpreter.

oneOf.description: A tool that runs Python code to help generate a response to a prompt.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool. Always local_shell.

oneOf.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

parameters.description: A JSON schema object describing the parameters of the function.

strict.description: Whether to enforce strict parameter validation.

type.description: The type of the function tool. Always function.

description.description: A description of the function. Used by the model to determine whether or not to call the function.

tools.description: An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You can specify which tool to use by setting the tool_choice parameter.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.
- auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
- disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

cached_tokens.description: The number of tokens that were retrieved from the cache.

input_tokens_details.description: A detailed breakdown of the input tokens.

output_tokens_details.description: A detailed breakdown of the output tokens.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used.

usage.description: Represents token usage details including input tokens, output tokens, a breakdown of output tokens, and the total tokens used.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the URL citation in the message.
